description: One-minute skill: Claudia Goldin: The Gender Pay Gap Decoded.

hook.text: In 2023, Claudia Goldin became the third woman ever to win the Economics Nobel. Her subject: 200 years of women's work.

buildup.text: Goldin traced women's labor force participation from 1800 to today. It's not a simple upward line â€” it's U-shaped.

discovery.text: The gender pay gap isn't mainly about discrimination.

twist.text: The gap explodes after the first child. Mothers shift to flexible jobs; fathers don't.

climax.text: Goldin showed that closing the pay gap requires redesigning jobs, not just fighting bias.

punchline.text: The pay gap isn't a glass ceiling. It's a greedy clock.

quiz.question: According to Goldin, what primarily drives the modern gender pay gap?
